research_questions.title: Assessment & Maturity
research_questions.question: How can SME-specific ESG indicators be operationalized into a structured self-assessment system that produces a meaningful ESG score?

research_questions.title: Predictive Capability
research_questions.question: Can machine learning models trained on limited ESG indicators accurately estimate SME ESG scores?

research_questions.title: Explainability & Trust
research_questions.question: Which ESG indicators most strongly influence predicted ESG scores, and can these influences be explained transparently?

research_questions.title: Decision Support
research_questions.question: Can explainable ESG predictions be translated into actionable improvement roadmaps for SMEs?

objectives.text: Design an SME-oriented ESG indicator framework
Implement an automated ESG scoring mechanism
Develop an ML-based ESG prediction model
Apply explainable AI to identify ESG drivers

hypotheses.text: SME ESG self-assessment scores correlate positively with ML-predicted ESG scores
Tree-based models outperform linear models in ESG score prediction
A small subset of ESG indicators explains the majority of score variance
Explainability improves decision usability for SMEs

methodology.label: Indicator Definition
methodology.description: Define SME-appropriate ESG indicators with low reporting burden.

methodology.label: Self-Assessment
methodology.description: Collect ESG data via Likert-scale self-assessment (0–5).

methodology.label: ESG Scoring
methodology.description: Aggregate indicator scores into a normalized ESG score (0–100).

methodology.label: ML Training
methodology.description: Train supervised regression models using ESG indicators.

methodology.label: Explainability
methodology.description: Apply SHAP-based explainable AI to identify ESG drivers.
